data: OB Evolving Chorioamnionitis or Intra-amniotic Infection (Module)
Refer to Fever in Labour: Initial Management Algorithm
Assess hourly for signs of sepsis

order rate: 80 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
For suspected chorioamnionitis or intra-amniotic infection, select [ceFAZolin and metroNIDAZOLE] OR [clindamycin and gentamicin]
Discontinue Penicillin G if Group B Strep is sensitive to ordered antibiotics

ceFAZolin can be safely administered to patients with penicillin allergy, including anaphylaxis. Do NOT administer if severe delayed skin reaction to any beta-lactam (e.g. drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis)

If BMI 35 kg/m2 or greater, refer to Parenteral Manual for gentamicin dosing in obese patients and provider to enter calculated dosing weight in gentamicin dosing calculator
If abnormal renal function, order loading and maintenance dose and consult pharmacy to adjust gentamicin dosing
